intro: Schismatoglottis wallichii var. fasciata, commonly known as the Zebra Plant, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a terrestrial herb with fleshy, dark green leaves that have distinctive white or pale green longitudinal stripes. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Schismatoglottis wallichii var. fasciata is popular as a decorative houseplant due to its unique leaf patterns and relatively easy care requirements.
